data.question: What is the empirical formula of the hexagon-shaped A6L6 complex?
What method was used for geometry optimizations in molecular modeling?
data.answer: The dispersion-corrected semiempirical PM6-D3 method.

data.question: Can the A6L6 hexagon and A4L4 square complexes interconvert?
data.answer: Yes, interconversion between the A6L6 hexagon and A4L4 square complexes can be realized by solvent regulation.

data.question: What is the role of [K([18]crown-6)]+ counterions in the structure of the A6L6 hexagon?
data.answer: The [K([18]crown-6)]+ counterions form hydrogen bonds with the terminal nitro groups and the oxygen atoms of urea groups of the ligands.

data.question: What technique was used to study the host-guest properties of the assemblies?
data.answer: NMR, UV-vis, and fluorescence spectroscopy were utilized to study the host-guest properties.

data.question: Is the A4L4 square complex capable of selectively binding methylene blue from a mixture of guests?
data.answer: Yes, the A4L4 square complex can selectively bind methylene blue from a mixture of guests.

data.question: What was the main purpose of using the SQUEEZE function in PLATON?
data.answer: The SQUEEZE function was employed to remove the contribution of electron density associated with disordered solvent and cations.

data.question: How were the hydrogen bonds around the PO4^3- ions in the A6L6 hexagon characterized?
data.answer: The hydrogen bonds around the PO4^3- ions in the A6L6 hexagon were characterized by distances and angles in the crystal structure.

data.question: Does the A6L6 hexagon complex show selectivity in encapsulating different guest molecules?
data.answer: No, the A6L6 hexagon complex shows no selectivity in encapsulating different guest molecules.

data.question: What was the yield of the A6L6 hexagon-shaped complex upon slow vapor diffusion of diethyl ether?
data.answer: The yield of the A6L6 hexagon-shaped complex was more than 90% upon slow vapor diffusion of diethyl ether.

data.question: What is the crystal system of the A4L4 square complex?
data.answer: The crystal system of the A4L4 square complex is triclinic.

data.question: Were the hydrogen atoms of water molecules included in the model for the A6L6 hexagon complex?
data.answer: No, the hydrogen atoms of water molecules were not included in the model for the A6L6 hexagon complex.

data.question: What was the main challenge in obtaining a reasonable model for the organic parts of the A6L6 hexagon complex?
data.answer: The main challenge was the limited resolution of the data and substantial thermal motion, requiring extensive use of restraints.

data.question: How was disorder in the 18-crown-6 moieties of the A4L4 square complex addressed?
data.answer: Disorder in the 18-crown-6 moieties was addressed by modeling as disordered over two locations and applying thermal parameter restraints.

data.question: What was the role of the GRADE program in refining the structures of the complexes?
data.answer: The GRADE program was used to generate a full set of bond distance and angle restraints for the organic ligands and 18-crown-6 moieties.

data.question: Did the A6L6 hexagon and A4L4 square complexes exhibit crystallographic centrosymmetry?
data.answer: Yes, both the A6L6 hexagon and A4L4 square complexes exhibited crystallographic centrosymmetry.

data.question: What was the method used for data collection in X-ray crystallography?
data.answer: Data collection was performed using a Bruker D8 Venture photon II diffractometer equipped with high-brilliance IμS Cu-Kα and MoKα sources.

data.question: How were the binding constants for guest molecules to the A6L6 hexagon complex determined?
data.answer: The binding constants were determined by 1H NMR titrations using the Hill equation.

data.question: Was the A6L6 hexagon complex able to encapsulate and release a desired guest by conversion from one host to another?
data.answer: Yes, the A6L6 hexagon complex was able to encapsulate and release a desired guest by conversion from one host to another.

data.question: What was the main finding regarding the solvent's role in the assembly of the complexes?
data.answer: The main finding was that solvent plays an important role in directing the outcomes of anion-coordination-driven assembly processes.
